page.title: 16NATIONAL EISTEDDFOD, RHYL
page.content: The Eisteddfod is a Welsh cultural festival held during the first week of August, in N. Wales one year, in S. Wales the next. The Bards of the Gorsedd perform the crowning and chairing ceremonies which can be seen in the Pavilion. The Gorsedd honour a number of people, chosen for their service to Wales or for having been successful in the Gorsedd examinations and they wear green, blue, white and gold robes. On the Tuesday and Thursday morning of Eisteddfod week a ceremony is held and lots of people come to see it. The Archdruid comes dressed in his gold robes. On the Eisteddfod field there will be the Main Pavilion, many smaller pavilions, stalls and side shows all using the Welsh language.
